exhibitions.title: Thresholds of Light
exhibitions.theme: Chiaroscuro and the architecture of stillness
exhibitions.summary: An intimate survey of works that treat shadow as a structural material—where the brightest point in the room is often not the canvas, but the air around it.
highlights: A corridor of single-light sources, each painting accompanied only by a line of text and a chair.
A chamber devoted to half-finished fresco studies, hung at eye level to reveal decision-making marks.
A closing room of contemporary responses to Baroque light, curated in near darkness.

exhibitions.title: Cartographies of Silence
exhibitions.theme: Mapping absence, distance, and the spaces between cities
exhibitions.summary: Large-scale works on paper, embossed metal, and layered textiles that redraw the world not by borders and coastlines, but by the routes of memory and migration.
highlights: An installation of suspended vellum maps whose inked shorelines blur into stitched red thread.
A listening room where visitors hear recorded footsteps from museum floors around the world.
A series of nocturnes in graphite and gold leaf, charting cities only by their reflected light.

exhibitions.title: Ceiling of Breath
exhibitions.theme: Reverent echoes of fresco ceilings and the weight of the sky
exhibitions.summary: A dialogue with historic ceiling paintings—from the Sistine Chapel to lesser-known chapels—through photographic studies, site-responsive works, and contemporary commissions hung low to invite contemplation.
highlights: High-resolution ceiling photographs printed on silk and gently moving with the air of the gallery.
A mirrored floor room where visitors look up and down to experience painted heavens as landscapes.
A series of small oil studies that isolate hands, folds of drapery, and fragments of sky from canonical frescoes.

exhibitions.title: Gilded Frequencies
exhibitions.theme: Gold leaf, reflection, and the choreography of viewers in space
exhibitions.summary: An exhibition that treats gold not as ornament but as a way of scoring how the body moves through a room—the shimmer marking where attention gathers and diverges.
highlights: A suite of monochrome paintings whose only variation is the location of a single gold interruption.
Mirrored plinths holding small, intensely detailed works lit at low levels to encourage slow viewing.
A live mapping of visitor movement translated into shifting bands of projected color on the walls.

exhibitions.title: Night Crossings
exhibitions.location: International Travelling Exhibition — Tokyo, New York, Lisbon
exhibitions.theme: Harbors, thresholds, and the luminous edge between departure and return
exhibitions.summary: A forthcoming international programme bringing together artists whose work lingers on ports, stations, and liminal architectures—places where strangers briefly share the same horizon.
highlights: Commissioned light installations responding to each city’s specific night sky and waterfront.
Archival material from historic passenger terminals, reframed as sculptural objects.
Programming that pairs late-night openings with live readings, music, and quiet gatherings.
